intro: Zieria laevigata var. revoluta, commonly known as the roughleaf zieria, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in fine, raised dots, giving them a rough texture. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. This species is often found in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
